entry.dcterms:description: The survey investigates how the social representations of the body get formulated, how they appear in the present Hungarian society and culture, and how this relates to the different aspects of "body politics" and identity. The main topics are habits of newspaper reading, life style, money spent on bodily care, smoking, habits of alcohol consumption, ideal and rejected bodies, popular and academic discourses, artificial interventions on the body, authoritarianism, the effect of the consumer society on the respresentations of the body.

The basic population of the sample consists of persons from Budapest, Debrecen and Pécs aged 18-40 years, with at least finished secondary school, who were recruited by way of newspaper advertisements, advertisements posted at the workplace, from among university students and with the help of the Labor Center. The number of persons thus recuited was appr. 600, out of which 468 responded to the questions.
